DOC.brief_summary: The primary goal of the study is to more firmly establish correlations between WheezeRate(Wz%) and other parameters used to assess wheezing and asthma including spirometry, provider's auscultation, and symptoms at the time of Wz% measurement.
DOC.criteria: Patients <= 12 years of age who have wheezing at the time of study as confirmed by the physicians' auscultation. Control: Patients <= 12 years of age without history of asthma or other pulmonary conditions, and who are without wheezing on physical exam. Medical problems that would contraindicate Wz% measurement.
